definitions: the condition of occurring in several different forms

examples.text: the complexity and polymorphism of human cognition

definitions: the occurrence of different forms among the members of a population or colony, or in the life cycle of an individual organism

examples.text: the workers of this species exhibit polymorphism, specialized physical castes

shortDefinitions: occurrence of different forms among members of population

definitions: the presence of genetic variation within a population, upon which natural selection can operate.
the occurrence of a number of alternative forms within a section of a nucleic acid or protein molecule.
shortDefinitions: occurrence of several alternative forms within section of nucleic acid or protein molecule

definitions: a feature of a programming language that allows routines to use variables of different types at different times

examples.text: object oriented programming introduces novel features like polymorphism
